SENT.plain: Cardiac disease is known to occur in patients with the multisystemic inflammatory disorder Behçet's disease
An aorto-atrial fistula secondary to Behçet's disease without a sinus of Valsalva aneurysm has not been previously reported
A 30 year old man with a four year history of symptoms and signs consistent with Behçet's disease presented with an aorto-atrial fistula and a large left to right shunt
At operation the defect was repaired with a bovine pericardial patch
There was no evidence of aneurysm formation
The patient made a good recovery and was well at one year follow up
